verse:
सर्वतःपाणिपादं तत्‌ सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखम्‌।
सर्वतःश्रुतिमल्लोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठति॥

terms.सर्वतःश्रुतिमल्लोके: in all the worlds, both heard and unheard

meaning: This verse describes the all pervading nature of the Supreme Being, God. The hands and feet of God are present everywhere, indicating that God is omnipresent. Similarly, the presence of eyes, heads, and mouths everywhere signifies that God is aware of everything happening in the universe. Furthermore, God's presence extends to all the worlds, including those that are known and unknown to humans. This verse conveys the idea that God encompasses everything and exists in every aspect of creation.
